dialogues.text: J sits in a small interview room, waiting, alone. DETECTIVE SENIOR SERGEANT NATHAN LECKIE (39) enters with DETECTIVE JUSTIN NORRIS (32) and social worker JOHN HARRO

dialogues.text: G'day, Josh. I’m Detective Senior Sergeant Leckie, this is Detective Norris. Leckie and Norris sit.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Mr. Harrop here is from the Department of Human Services. It’s a requirement under the law that in questioning anyone under the age of 18, they must be accompanied by a guardian or legal representative. In the absence of such a person, a department officer such as John must be present. I must also advise you that you are under no obligation to say anything at this point, but anything you do or say can be used as evidence in any later court appearances. Do you understand this Josh? J nods. Leckie speaks casually, reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: We won’t need to keep you too long.

dialogues.text: Last night two police officers were shot dead investigating a stolen car in Hawthorn. Leckie gauges J’s reaction. J shifts. Norris takes notes.

dialogues.text: 17 Harding Street, Ivanhoe.

dialogues.text: And what were you doing at home last night? J looks around the room. The men watch him closely.

dialogues.text: Watching TV.

dialogues.text: Were your uncles at that same address with you last night? Seconds into the interview J finds himself having to fabr answers to simple questions. Norris takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: They were home but I fell asleep pretty early so I wouldn't have a clue really what they were up to. I think they might have just been watching TV sort of thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 51.

dialogues.text: They were watching TV with you?

dialogues.text: What were you watching?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I think it was probably like 'Funniest Home Videos'. I was pretty much just having a nap on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: And at some point during the evening all three of your uncles came into the room, or only one, or two maybe? Can you tell me exactly who was there? J’s fact fabrication is only getting deeper. He wants out

dialogues.text: I can’t really tell you. I was that sleepy I only remember that there were people around, but I’m not sure who exactly. I basically had my eyes shut sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: You don’t remember who you heard?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: (pauses) The reason I was so sleepy and don’t remember was because I smoked some marijuana and I was knocked out sort of thing. I didn’t want to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: It's OK, Josh. We’re not concerned with what you smoked. Norris looks up from his note taking.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Do you remember where you were when you heard the news of Barry Brown's death? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Smurf, Pope and Darren sit in a booth in an empty diner, up for the evening.

dialogues.text: Have you forgotten what Baz did for you? Who's been giving you money? Me and Baz have. What's Craig been giving you? He's making a fuckin fortune. How much is he giving you?

dialogues.text: Thank you, love. Do you think we could have the bill, please? The waitress leaves. Smurf turns back to Pope.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: He’s dead. Darren’s mobile phone rings. He answers quietly.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I know you care, honey. Just don’t you be thinking you care in some special way, like nobody else does.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: Craig’s here. Darren stands and exits. Smurf watches Pope. He seems mee licks her thumb, wipes a smudge of food from his lips. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 55.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Maybe you should think about taking your pills again. Smurf pulls a pile of change from her purse and counts it table. Darren re-enters with Craig. Craig is freaking out takes a seat at the table. Other diners glance up.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: What the fuck? What were they doing there so quick? It’s like they fuckin know something.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: They know who Baz’s friends are. Keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: If they had anything we’d still be in there.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: They want to talk to you too, love. You should call Ezra and take yourself in tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I’m not going in there. Are you fuckin nuts?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: If you don’t, hon, they’1l1 think you’ve got something to hide.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I fuckin do. I’m not going in there.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: They'11 come looking for you if you don't, honey. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Where's J?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I should just carry about my daily business like normal. Don't you think? Pope looks at Darren. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Where's J? Darren shrugs. He doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Where's J? Is he still in there?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: Dunno.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: I don't know. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: If he’s not talking, what are they still talking about?

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: I don't fuckin know. Why are you asking me like I'd know?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: OK. We should leave now.
83 J is in the front seat. Norris drives. They drive in sile

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: It’s the next left. Not this one, the next one. Norris hits the indicator and drives around the corner. O metres around it, he pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: I’m not driving you home, cunt. Get out of my fucking car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 57.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: J is suddenly gripped with fear. He opens the door and ge Norris screeches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus opens the back door. J is there, unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Is Nicky here?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: She’s not home yet. You hungry? We're about to eat.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Maybe. Thanks. J enters. Gus shuts the door behind him. Alicia is in the kitchen cooking. She looks up at J coolly.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs Henry.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Call me Alicia, J.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: J's staying for tea. Gus takes a beer from the fridge and takes a seat next to watching TV. J stands behind the couch, then wanders over kitchen, where Alicia serves food onto plates.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Can I help?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: You could set the table. J sets about laying the table carefully. He is familiar w kitchen. He knows where to find place mats, cutlery etc.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: How was your day today?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: It was OK. Awkward silence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 58.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: How was yours?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: It was good. (to Gus and Andy) Dinner’s ready. (to J, cool) Can you take those plates? Alicia and J carry plates. Gus MUTES the TV. He and Andy their seats at the table.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: How was your friend's funeral?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: It was OK. Sad and everything.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: We saw it on the news last night. J can see the MUTED TV. A news report about the police mu We see images around the table intercut with NEWS FOOTAGE crime scene: the police car in Davis Ave, the stolen Comm white. Academy graduation photos of the two officers. J’s heart stops when he sees the car. He notices Gus watc the report too. They eat in silence. The back door opens. It's Nicky in s uniform,

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Where have you been, Nicole? She rounds the table to J, kissing Andy's cheek on the wa

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Detention. I told you. She sits on J's lap and picks at his plate. J is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: No, you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I did. You had to sign the form.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I signed the form. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 86 87 88 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 59.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Well then get angry at him for not telling you. I can't be having to tell both of you everything all the time. Maybe you two should try communicating. J isn't listening to a word of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig fills his tank at a country freeway service station car pulls into a parking bay outside the store. Two cops of the car. One takes a good look at Craig as they walk i the store. Craig looks straight ahead at the pump display ticking over. He turns to see the cops standing at the magazine stand. bowser clicks off. He replaces his petrol cap. He opens the car door. On the floor of the passenger side pump-action shotgun. Craig grabs his wallet and pulls a t over the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig enters the store. The cops are at the magazine stan look up. One looks straight back at his magazine, the oth gaze lingers. Craig walks past them to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Just the petrol. The attendant checks the pump display. Craig fidgets. The curious cop watches him.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Forty-five fifty. Craig produces a wad of cash from his pocket. The cop wat The attendant watches. Craig is nervy. He leaves fifty on counter and heads straight out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig makes the walk back to his car. Behind we can see t cops watching him through the store window. INT. NICKY’S BEDROOM / HENRY-EMERY HOUSE - DAY 88 J’s eyes open. There is a KNOCK at the bedroom door. The daylit. For a second he doesn’t know where he is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 60.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: J? Are you in there?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Fuck. (loud) Yep.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Your uncle’s at the door.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I’m coming. Nicky stirs. She’s in her pyjamas. J shoves her.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I told you don't let me fall asleep. Nicky rolls over, awake but gummy-eyed. J scrounges aroun the floor for his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I fell asleep. J has found his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: You got into your fuckin PJs.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I was still gonna wake you up. J heads for the door. J's anxiety takes Nicky by surprise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren waits in the front foyer, making small talk with A J enters, holding his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: We gotta go. Nicky enters, still half asleep. Darren eyebrows hello.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hey, Daz. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 91 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 61.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: (shakes Alicia's hand) Good to meet you. Darren and J head out the door. Nicky stands in the doorw watching them go, rag-doll sleepy. Alicia is apprehensive

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: I do a lot for you, Nick. You're still at school and you're allowed to have your boyfriend sleep over. That's a big thing for me. I'm not a bad person. Nicky steps to her and hugs her sleepily. Mum hugs her ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and J walk to the car. J carries shoes. He can see in the passenger seat. J climbs in the backseat. Pope doe even acknowledge J's presence.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: See our lawyer. Darren starts the car. As it pulls away, J notices Pope l at the house, Gus' car in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen/sun room of an inner-city terrace house. E WHITE (36), is making plunger coffee. J, Pope, Darren and sit nearby at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: This is really fuckin important, mate. I can't stress it enough. I need to know word for word.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: They just kept on asking me a couple of questions and I told them I don't know, then they let me go.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: What were you doing in there so long?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Nothing. They made me sit there with no one coming in or anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 62.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Good, OK. Now I want you to listen carefully to this. From now on, mate I don't want you saying anything. That means nothing at all. No 'I don't know'. No 'I was sleepy'. You just refuse to answer questions. You got that? By law these cunts can't make you say anything. You don't even have to give them your name. OK? It's very important. Don't let them push you around. Just sit there in silence. At least til I get there. Ezra takes a seat at the table with J.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: This goes for your girlfriend too. What’s her name?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: N'cole.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Cole?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: NICole.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Nicole. This goes for Nicole too. There's things you don’t talk to girls about, mate. Doesn’t matter how special they are. Doesn’t matter what you have or haven’t done. They get scared. And they natter, you know? They can’t help it. It’s the way the world works. J looks up at Smurf and Darren and nods.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Good on ya, mate. There's really not much to understand. Just, you know... shut up.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Are you clear with all that, honey?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Yep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 93 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 638.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. You want a drink? I've got lots of different kinds of drinks. Pope watches J like a snake watching a mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud BLAST rings out. Craig laughs, holding a shotgun. speeding and hasn’t slept. He has just blasted a chunk ou old tree beside an isolated bush house.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Fuckin monster! He aims and fires again, tearing a hole in the tree's tru

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Can we go hunting this arvo? RICHARD COLLIS (30s) stands nearby, nervous, his arms fol over his dressing gown. He's wearing gum boots.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Maybe. I got some things I gotta do today. Can you not blow my tree up?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: It’s fucked. Look at it. It’s written off. (offers Richard the gun) Give it a whirl.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It just needs a good rain. My brekkie's going cold. You wanna come inside? Craig takes aim and fires, tearing into the tree again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard sits at the table, poking his breakfast. His wife DACINTA stands behind, watching. They are wary of Craig a table, tuning his radio scanner, scatter-brained.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How long were you wanting to stay? Where's Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: We split up. Ages ago. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 64.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Shit, mate.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was mutual though, so it's for the best and everything. (re: the scanner) Stupid fuckin... Maybe I'm too far out to get signals, d'ya think?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Is everything OK, mate? Craig doesn't respond. He keeps fiddling.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What’s with the scanner?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I’1l fight through, mate. I’1l fight through. Dacinta exits, making stern eye contact with Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I think it's fair enough to say, if you're gonna stay here for a while, you know, it's only fair that you tell us what's this all about... Is that fair?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on, mate. He works at the aerial while the scanner emits STATIC. Ri dogs are outside, BARKING. Craig stops fiddling and liste only can he hear the dogs barking out in the yard, but he hear them through the scanner as well.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I can hear your dogs. Craig jumps up and heads outside. Through the windows, Ri can see him walking close around the outside of the house examining the walls and windows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 65.

dialogues.speaker: DACINTA
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: DACINTA
dialogues.text: Tell him he can't stay here.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I can't tell him anything. Then, through the scanner, they hear Craig’s VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You cunt motherfuckers! After a loud CRUNCH, the scanner returns to steady STATIC Craig bursts back in, near hysterical, dangling wires.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this, Rich?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What is it? I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: It's a bug. There's a bug on your fuckin house.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don't know about it.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Bull-fuckin-shit, Rich! How could there be a bug on your house within like, 24 hours of me telling you I was coming?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Maybe they were tapping your phone or something. I don't know how it got there. I'm not lying.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Fuck! Craig grabs his shotgun and paces.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Fuck! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His eyes fill with childlike despair. Richard and Dacinta both wary of the shotgun he holds by his side.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: What I am supposed to do now?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don't know, mate. Maybe you should think about leaving.

dialogues.speaker: DACINTA
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Craig paces, then stops, on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Maybe I should get outta here. Craig picks his bag off the ground. He sweeps his scanner it and looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: What else did I bring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen door swings open, smacking against the front o house. Craig stumbles down off the porch and opens the ba of his car, throwing his bag inside. He scrambles around backseat for shotgun shells. He begins loading them into shotgun, fumbling, dropping them. His ears prick. He sees a convoy of unmarked police cars approaching fast down the long, dirt drive. He crouches against the car and loads more shells. He loo the house in panic. Richard's at the window, looking back Craig stands and runs into the bush behind the house. The cars come to a stop at the house. Detectives with sho climb out and chase Craig into the bush. Craig breathes heavy, sprinting through the undergrowth. trips, smashing his knees into a log. He squeals in pain gets to his feet. He tries to run but can't, hobbled. He turns, raises his gun. Detectives are close behind. Th and fire. Craig is hammered by a blast and knocked down. SILENCE but for SINGING BIRDS and the ECHO OF GUNSHOTS. Detectives, guns by their sides, approach Craig’s bloody face down in the dirt.  95 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pope stands holding Evie like he's never held a baby befo Cath searches the fridge, nervous and drunk

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Where should I put this?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Just set her back down. Pope sets Evie down in her a bassinet and lets her grip h finger. Cath fixes a drink at the kitchen bench. She puts lid back on a bottle of tonic.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Aren’t you getting me a drink? Cath shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I don’t know I want you to stay. Cath sips nervously, looks out the window. Pope watches h

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I want free of this shit, I think.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: What shit?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: See that little thing you're poking like she's a dog? Her dad's dead.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Everything's good now.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Stop saying everything's good. What's good now? I got cops on my door all hours of the fuckin night. When does the good bit start? Pope steps to her. He takes the drink out of her hand and her close. She's uncomfortable. They almost imperceptibly dance for a moment. Pope whispers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 97 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: You're not thinking of doing anything stupid, are you? Cath pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of my house. Pope stands awkward, staring. Cath holds her ground. Pope exits. Cath picks up her drink and sips, unnerved. flinches as the door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pope heads down the drive. A neighbour waters his lawn.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you looking at?

She 96 97 Leckie is sitting on a kid's tricycle. His six year-old s has Down Syndrome, is trying to get him off it. Leckie la His son gets mad. Leckie's mobile phone rings. LECKIE'S W preparing food behind him, slides the phone across the co to him. Leckie drops it, picks it up and answers.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: G'day, mate.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Craig Cody's gone, mate.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: What? How? Leckie stands and moves away from his family.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS, (OVER)
dialogues.text: He found the listening device in Bendigo. He sounded unhinged, so we went in to apprehend him and he lost the plot. We had to drop him.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Why didn't anyone call me? I would've got the Special Operations Group up there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS, (OVER)
dialogues.text: No time for that, mate. He just lost the plot.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: OK, gimme a sec. Gimme a sec to think... Leckie paces.
98 Smurf sits numb on the kitchen floor. She's been crying. crouches beside her with a glass of water. Pope paces.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: (to J, close) I'm having trouble finding my positive spin. I'm usually very good at it Usually it's right there and I can just have it. But I'm having trouble finding it now.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: This is what I'm trying to say. I don't know why people don't listen. If you hadn't gotten in his ear about handing himself over, there'd be none of all this carrying on. (to J) And if you hadn't've gone to your girlfriend's house instead of coming home after. Did you think about that when you were doing it? You've gone and spooked him. Both of you. And now look. Smurf lifts herself up, walks to Pope and mechanically pu him in the face. Pope flinches. He looks surprised. She punches him again. He almost cowers like a kid.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Don't take it out on me. I didn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I thought that’s what we did. We take it out on whoever shows up. Smurf punches again. He grabs her arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 70.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Don't. J watches from the floor, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Leave her alone. Pope's attention shifts to J.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: (looking at Pope, calm) I’m alright, J.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Just relax.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Come here, mate.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Don't you touch him. J hasn't moved. He's scared. Pope is menacingly calm.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Come here, mate.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Relax.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Stop being a child. Pope releases Smurf and goes for J. J scuttles across the and out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J scurries into the hall, Pope close behind. As J reaches front door, the BELL rings. J and Pope stop. They stand confused. J looks back, then opens the door. It's Leckie.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Josh. I've come to talk to you. I've got some bad news.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: He knows the bad news. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leckie notices the tense atmosphere in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Is everything OK here?

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Everything’s great here.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Josh? Smurf enters the hall, strangely calm.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: He’s fine, Mr Leckie.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: (to J) I'd like you to come down to St Kilda Road with me.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: What's he done? Tell me and I'll make sure he gets discipline.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Will you come with me now?

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: What do you wanna ask him about? Ask me.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: (to Pope) We'll speak to you again at a later time, when we're ready. Will you come with me, Josh?

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: I might have some info for you about those murdered police. I've been asking some people and there's a few theories floating around. I don't know if they're true or not, but at least it could maybe help you with your investigations. Leckie ignores Pope. He concentrates on J.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Will you come with me, Josh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 101 102 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 72.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: (to J) You go, love. I'll call Ezra. Go get your shoes. J hesitates, then disappears past Pope, into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J sits on the couch and puts on his sneakers. Pope enters

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Sorry if we had some confusion there before. It's crazy times. J ignores him and keeps tying his laces.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: You're not alone on this. You know that, yeah? J stands and moves to leave. Pope stops him.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Yeah? J nods. Pope hugs him. J feels deep discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: We'll get through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smurf and Leckie stand awkward at the front door together

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: I'm not presently in a position to discuss what happened today, but I can arrange for counselling services to visit should you require any. Leckie knows his words are empty, but he feels compelled something. Smurf watches him with calm, eerie contempt. J appears again with Pope and steps out beside Leckie.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: This is a record of interview between Detective Senior Sergeant Nathan Leckie and Joshua Daniel Cody. Present is solicitor Ezra White. Josh, you're under no obligation to say anything at this time but anything you do say can be used in future court appearances. Do you understand that? J sits silent. Ezra looks up, distracted.

dialogues.text: He understands that.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Picking up where we left off, when we last spoke, you were telling us how upset your uncles were over the death of Barry Brown. Can you recall exactly what was said at that time? J sits silent, but can already feel Leckie digging a hole him. Leckie waits for J to respond. He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Josh, has Mr White provided you with advice in respect to how should conduct yourself in this interview today?

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: He'll be remaining mute.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: I can appreciate you’ve been advised not to say anything to me, but the sooner you help us with our enquiries the sooner we can scratch you off the list and move on to a different line. Do you understand that? You don’t want to tell us any more? Is that correct? J stays silent. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Is there any further statement you wish to make in relation to this matter? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: You know what the bush is about? It's about massive trees that've been standing for thousands of years and bugs that'll be dead before the minute's out. J sits, face in hands. Leckie flicks the pebble off his k

dialogues.text: It's big trees and pissy little bugs. The way it works, if we were standing here a few million years ago, maybe the whole forest'd be full of impractical animals and soft juicy plants that animals eat like ice cream. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: But that was never gonna work, so now it's about super-efficient animals and hard thorny plants and everything knows it's place in the scheme of things. Everything sits in the order somewhere. Things survive coz they're strong and everything reaches an understanding. Leckie, eyes down, gives J a moment to take this in.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: But not everything survives because it's strong. Some creatures are weak but they survive because they're protected by the strong. For one reason or other. Leckie takes another moment.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE

And that's nothing against you. You're weak because you're young. You've survived because you've been protected by the strong. But they aren't strong anymore and they certainly aren't protecting you. (beat) I have a son with Down Syndrome. You know what that is?... He's six. He wouldn't last a day out here by himself. But he doesn't have to. Because I'm looking out for him. And he lets me look out for him. Leckie watches J. J stares at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: We’re here because we know who you are and we know what you’ve done. (beat) You feel like you're in a tough situation. But you have an out. There’s nothing your uncles can do to squirm out of this. Craig’s learnt it the hard way. But you’re not one of them. You know that. (beat) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Don't be confused about it. I think you know. And I think you know I can help you. But I can’t keep offering. You gotta decide. You gotta work out where you fit. J wants help, but can't look up.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE

dialogues.text: How does he know where I am?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN, (OVER)
dialogues.text: I dunno. Just get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J enters the living area again. He is frightened. He does want to leave Gus and Andy in the house with Pope on the

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Can you give me a lift somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I dunno, J. I’ve got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: It’s just that I’m late. To the shops would be good. Gus considers J’s disposition.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I should get out of the house, I suppose. Give us a minute. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 130 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gus exits, leaving J standing, anxious, watching Andy wit video game. Gus returns with Andy’s shoes.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. We're going for a ride. J wants the whole process to hurry up. Shoes on, Gus and head to the back door. J follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is in the garage, dark. J gets in the passenger s waiting anxious, as Gus gets Andy into the back seat Gus gets behind the wheel. He starts the engine and press garage door controller in the glove box. The door rises s Sunlight streams in. Gus backs the car out. I/E. GUS’S CAR - DAY 130 J looks down the street. It’s empty. Gus puts the car in and moves off. J cranes around to look out the back windo the street. Then - CRACK. The car is clipped hard from the front. It spins w then comes to a rest. Through the window, J can see Pope the wheel of Darren's car, undoing his seat belt. Pope's jammed between Gus's car and another parked in the street can't open any doors - he's trapped inside. J clambers into the backseat, past Gus who is dazed, bloo trickling down his forehead. J stumbles out the backdoor into the street. He looks bac locks eyes with Gus, who looks back at him, vacant. And t everything slows. J notices moments - a neighbour in a dr gown. J runs. MUSIC CUE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J sits on a bench, mobile in hand. Leckie and two detecti walk through the supermarket, handguns discreetly drawn. find J and help him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car appears under the rollerdoor to an underground carp J is led from the car to the elevator. Surrounded by dete in suits with guns, the elevator doors close.  131 133 134 136 139 140 141 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky's body is slumped in long grass beside railway trac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus is on the phone. Alicia’s on her knees, crying beside Andy stands alone watching, distressed and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine holds Evie, staring through the curtained windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pope and Darren are cuffed on the floor, neither talking. is anguished, Pope stony-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smurf sits at the kitchen table dunking a tea bag, while clothes and uniformed police move around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leckie drives alone on a desolate outer suburban street. pulls up outside a nondescript brick house. END MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leckie walks to the front door of the house and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Detective Senior Sergeant Leckie. The sound of LOCKS being undone precedes the door opening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leckie enters. At the door is an unfriendly Protective Se Group (PSG) officer in sweatshirt, jeans, sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: DOOR PSG
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Where is he?  142 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leckie enters. J is watching TV. A PSG sits behind him, a watching. The air is cold, the room barren, barely furnis

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: (to lounge PSG) Can you leave us for a bit? The LOUNGE PSG exits. Leckie shuts the door behind him, t sits opposite J. J ignores him, staring at the Tv.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: How you going? Leckie speaks quietly. J doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Have any threats been made against you? J doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: In your last record of interview you told Detective Foulkes you were getting grief from your minders. Now I can have you moved somewhere else. I can have new Protective Security Group officers appointed. But you have to tell me this. I can't be hearing it from other people.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I wanna know what’s gonna happen after all this, about where I'm gonna live and my new name and that.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: You’11 be looked after. Don’t worry about that. I’m more concerned with how happy you are now. Do you want me to move you? Do you want me to appoint new PSGs? J doesn’t respond. He stares at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Yes or no is all I need. J nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 144 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 94.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: OK. The earliest I can make this happen is tomorrow morning. Will you be alright here tonight? J nods. Leckie stands, putting a hand on J’s shoulder. Le exits the room, shutting the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD PSG is waiting in the foyer with the Door PSG.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD PSG
dialogues.text: You can't just turn up here. You want to see him in future, you need to make proper arrangements for that to take place somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: I'd really like to follow the rules but it doesn't seem like anyone else is.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD PSG
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Why am I explaining this to you? He's with us. I know you’re emotional, but he’s with us now, which is no guarantee he'll be with us tomorrow. I shouldn’t have to be saying this. But for some reason right now I feel like I have to explain it to you. Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: HEAD PSG
dialogues.text: I really appreciate your help with my job, mate. I really do. I know how busy you are. I think it'd be best if you skedaddled now. Leckie doesn’t want these men as enemies. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD PSG
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. Off you fuck faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J sits. The lounge PSG enters with a dog bowl and can of food. He puts the bowl on the coffee table in front of J empties the can into the bowl. He taps the can with a spo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 95.

dialogues.speaker: LOUNGE PSG
dialogues.text: Dinner’s ready, cunt. J ignores him and the bowl and continues staring at the T hears MEN LAUGHING in another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pope sits behind grubby Perspex. Darren is just behind hi quiet. Smurf is on the other side of the glass.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Ezra says don't get your hopes up about the committal.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: He said there was still strings he could pull.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: They're all pulled. Smurf is concerned about Darren’s non-communication.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: (to Darren, softly) How are you keeping, hon? Darren doesn’t respond. He’s obviously not keeping well.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: What did he say about whomping that bail application in? Is he on this thing or what?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Darren, honey? Say something.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Answer her. Darren starts crying quietly.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: What's going on in here? Are you looking after your brother?

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: (to Darren) Say hi to mum, sook. (to Smurf) What did Ez say about whomping that bail application in? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 96.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: What do you think he said? It's been whomped. You're not getting bail. What on Earth makes you think you might get bail? What do you think you're in here for?

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Oh, fuckin don't start up again.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: If you let anything happen to him in here...

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: What. What are you gonna do, mum? Smurf watches Darren. She knocks lightly on the Perspex.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Darren honey, talk to mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet. The garage door opens. Two sedans emerge. O street, they peel away in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives. Leckie is in back, with another detective sits between them, bent over in ‘crash position'.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT
dialogues.text: Smurf stands in a city street talking to Ezra, who sits i wheel drive. Smurf's in fur coat, big sunglasses; Ezra in suit. He reads a small scrap of paper.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: You sure this is the address he's been moved to? How did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: That's the address.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Get in the car. Smurf gets in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: You really want to go down that road? We're still working on it. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (re: the address) Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I've been around a long time, sweetie. J's turned. He's not coming back. Even if the boys get off, I won't see him again. I won’t let Darren rot in that place. If they go down, that's it I've got no one left. Ezra considers this, unsure, looking at the piece of pape

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: J's gone either way. We need to set up a meeting. Is your office safe? INT. EZRA WHITE’S OFFICE - DAY 149 Ezra is at his desk. On a couch is Detective Roache, Crai Drug Squad contact from the pet store. Smurf sits beside

dialogues.speaker: ROACHE
dialogues.text: I know you've got a problem, Janine. But I don’t see how this mess your boys are in has anything to do with me. If you’ve called me in here to see if there’s strings I can pull, you’re way off course. Smurf doesn't respond. She fiddles with her purse.

dialogues.speaker: ROACHE
dialogues.text: Is that what this is about?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Hey Randall, before you go on, this boy who’s currently being looked after, tell me if you agree with this this boy who's being looked after - he knows who you are. Roache looks to Ezra. Ezra watches Roache.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: And you know how these things go. They'll ask him all sorts of questions, about everything he's ever seen or done and everyone he's ever met. The whole shemozzle. And you've done some bad things, sweetie... Haven't you?... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kipagiom - GREEN REVISIONS 98.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I want this part to be clear so you're not thinking this is about you doing me a favour or I'm blackmailing you or anything like that. It’s just a bad situation for everyone. Roache looks to Ezra who remains impassive. Roache drops eyes. Smurf pauses. She knows she’s ordering J’s executio

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Ezra has the address. I don't think it should be hard to set up a raid on the house. There’d be reasonable grounds with all the strange activity and comings and goings day and night, and maybe a neighbour spotted a gun somewhere. This is your field of expertise. I don't mean to tell you how to suck eggs. What do you think? Roache is now massaging his face.

dialogues.speaker: ROACHE
dialogues.text: I really don't see how anything can be done.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Randall. (beat) I feel sick right now. I’m not happy about this at all. Not one bit. But we do what we must. Just because we don’t want to do it doesn’t mean it can’t be done. Roache looks up at Ezra, who is doodling on a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J and Leckie in the kitchen of a new suburban safe house. at the stove stirring a pot. Leckie pulls a jar from a pl shopping bag and screws its lid open.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: This is the stuff. This Vietnamese noodle soup place on Russell St makes it. Smell that. Leckie puts the jar under J's nose. J recoils.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: That's real chilli sauce. J laughs. His nostrils are burning. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 152 153 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 99.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: I didn't say suck it in. I said give it a whiff. Leckie screws the lid back on and grabs his keys and wall

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Alright, I have to take off. Keep the noodles in the stock for another minute or two. I'd say. Or just taste them - whenever they're ready. And then pull it off and chuck the rest in. Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Yep. Do I need to keep stirring?

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: No. Just pull it off in a minute. OK. Top work. I'll see you later. J keeps stirring.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: See ya later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM, a new PSG, sits in a chair by the front door with a Magazine. The house is quiet. J is in the lounge watching eating noodle soup. He's struggling with chopsticks. PSG SANTO, signals urgently to Tom towards the front door peers outside through the blinds. Across the street, two men in sneakers and jeans creep to the house carrying shotguns. Then, two more appear

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roache holds back, still on the far side of the street. H shotgun. He's edgy. He crosses the street warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PSGs Tom, Santo and GARY are now at the front door, guns Tom peeks through the blinds. Four people creep towards t house. J hangs back, watching from a doorway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 154 155 156 157 158 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 100.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They look like cops.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. What are we doing? J backs away into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As officers approach the house, Roache peels away alone, the side of the house, gun ready. He knows where he’s goi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PSGs are panicked. Gary looks through the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: SANTO
dialogues.text: Fuck it. We surrender.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: There's about six of them.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure they're cops.

dialogues.speaker: SANTO
dialogues.text: I'm not fighting a war. There's no way I'm fighting a war over some fuckwit kid. Fuck it, I'll shoot him myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J crosses through the bedroom to the en-suite bathroom. H climbs onto the toilet seat and opens the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santo puts his gun down and kneels, hands behind his head does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J crouches on the window ledge. He looks around to see Ro approaching. They lock eyes. J jumps onto the neighbourin fence. Roache raises his gun, but J is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ROACHE
dialogues.text: Fuck! (into walkie-talkie) Abort! They’re cops! Fuck!  159 160 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J runs through a neighbouring backyard. Two boys his own stand beside a swimming pool in board shorts. They look u him, stunned, as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smurf prepares cookie mix. An old lady, HELEN, sits at th kitchen table reading a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Oh goodness, no. I don't like him. His teeth are crooked.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I don't care for him.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: You would've thought the executives at that station, if they need a new host for their show, they could find someone with straighter teeth. KNOCK at the door. Smurf wipes her hands, goes to answer

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I don't mind his personality, but his mouth is very off-putting. Smurf answers the door. J is there.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Is anyone inside?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: My neighbour Helen's here, love.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. I'm gonna get Pope out of jail. I can't live like this.  Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 102.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SMURF'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: J leads Smurf to a quiet spot just outside her flat.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I wanna set up a meeting with Ezra and that barrister from the committal.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Of course. OK.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I don't trust Ezra. I'm not going to anyone's house. It has to be somewhere public. But it also has to be somewhere that no one we know would go.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: OK, honey. OK. I'm just glad your home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J, Ezra, Smurf and barrister JOHN HOPPER sit on benches i middle of a major hall of the art gallery. Hopper observe occasionally glancing at the art around him.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I'm not coming home.

dialogues.speaker: EZRA
dialogues.text: Mate, if you really want to help the boys, coming home's the thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I'm not coming home. I'm not safe there.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Yes, you are, dear.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I'm not. I'm not safe in witness protection either, but I'd rather take my chances there.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: You'll be safe at home, honey.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: You can't promise me that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 103.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I can. I can.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I'm not coming home. I'm going back there. I'm just here to let you know that I'm gonna help. Smurf looks to Hopper. Hopper shrugs, leans back

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: I think J's made his position clear. Where that leaves us now is to decide how best to proceed given the brave offer of assistance he's made. (beat) This thing's going to trial, with or without J. That's a given. What we want is to win it. What I liked about the committal hearing - despite the fact that we've been ordered to stand trial, of course - but what I liked about the committal was that, for the most part, their case looked pretty flimsy to me, largely dependent on testimony that shouldn't be too hard to discredit I wouldn't have thought. And if the committal was any indicator, J here's their little star. If he's not there, they'll need to strengthen their brief with something else, which they will do. And they'll have the time to do it. And I'd personally rather tackle the evidence I saw at the committal than whatever rejigged brief they come up with should J suddenly decide to leave. You know what I mean? (to J) So now we should just make proper use of the time we have. We'll need to go over a bunch of things here. Like, for instance, this whole business of the car you claim you stole and that you claim you saw on the TV. It was just a white car wasn't it? Millions of white cars in the world. Why was that one so familiar? Probably looked very similar to that one that guy drives on that show, some show you watch all the time. You know? (beat) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161 162 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now, we also want to make sure you don't perjure yourself in the process mate, so we need to be careful how we play it. This may involve you having to answer some questions about the death of Nicole. My guess is you may not like it. Do you think you'll be OK with it?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I'll be fine with it.
161 J walks the drive to the safe house. New model cars parke outside. The front door is busted. J enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162 The house feels crowded with men in suits who fall silent enters. Leckie pushes to the front and leads J by the arm the kitchen. He's clearly been worried.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Hiding.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have left the house. Where did you go?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I was hiding.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: It was the Drug Squad who raided the house today. They'd been told something funny was going on here. OK? It was a mix up. You’re in no danger I need you to understand that.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Did anyone see you today?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 163 164 165 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 105.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Nobody saw me. Leckie looks frazzled. He puts his hand on J's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J stands looking out the floor-to-ceiling windows of a hi serviced apartment at the city sprawling to the horizon. dressed for court - pants and round neck jumper over a co shirt and tie. He looks healthy and strong. He scuffs his nervously against the tiled floor. Leckie appears beside him and looks out the window a mome then straightens J’s collar

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: You ready? J nods. Leckie turns and nods to two SOG officers in full flak jackets, helmets, shotguns. The four stand waiting i the front door. One SOG pulls the apartment door open. Ou is another SOG. He hand-signals to someone off screen. Leckie gently guides J from the window to the door, out i hall of the building towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J in the back of a mini-van. Leckie is beside him. As the pulls out of an underground car park onto the street the officer in the front seat leans into his personal radio.

dialogues.speaker: SOG
dialogues.text: We’re on the move.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Copy that. Leckie watches J. J looks out the window. The radio crack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vans are admitted through the back gates of the court building. The gates are quickly closed by court officers. The van stops at the back entrance. A SOG emerges first followed by J, then another two SOGs. J is hurried inside  166 169 170 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J sits in a holding area. There is quiet and tense antici He is clearly the centre of concern. He sits and waits. A warden approaches.

dialogues.speaker: COURT WARDEN
dialogues.text: OK. They're ready for you now. J stands and is escorted down a hall. He and the warden w outside a door. The door opens. J enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the holding area, the air is muted and tense. Radi crackle. Wardens and cops sit in silence, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK: Hopper sits opposite J at a quiet table. Ezra Smurf sit at the next table. Ezra takes notes. Smurf watc

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Your girlfriend Nicole died froma heroin overdose. Is this true?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Is it true that you believe your uncles were responsible for this?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: They injected her.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Maybe don't rush your answers, mate. The more you hesitate, the more uncertain you'll appear.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: How's he gonna remember all this?

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to remember it. It's better if he doesn't. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J nods. Animal Ki nadem - GREEN REVISIONS 107. We don't want him reciting lines. All he needs to do here is get into the swing of the thing. He just needs to wrap his head around the flavour of it. (beat, to J) You understand that, mate?

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, you're saying they forcibly injected her with what's known as a hot shot? Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Did you see them do this?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I came home and found her bracelet thing in the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: But you didn’t actually see her there, nor did you see anyone inject her. Was she known to you to be a user of heroin?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Sometimes, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Was she? This is me talking now.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Then say no. You don't need to lie... Was there any reason why she might have wanted to use heroin on this particular night?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Maybe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 108.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: Why maybe?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I broke up with her.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: That night?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: So to an extent you feel responsible for Nicole’s death.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I dunno. Maybe to an extent.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER
dialogues.text: But you want your uncles put away for it. Even though you didn’t see them do it and she was justifiably upset on this particular night because you ended the relationship. J looks coolly to Ezra taking notes and Smurf watching.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re looking for someone to blame for something you feel responsible for. Would you agree with that? Blah blah blah. J looks to Hopper, defiant. He holds it.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's good, mate. You feel OK?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Are you OK, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Can you find us a drink Smurf?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: Of course. I'm sure I saw a drink machine somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commotion. J is led from the court, through back corridor  172 173 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van drives through the back gate of the court, J surr by SOGs with shotguns. J is pensive. Heavily armed SOG pr is oppressive - gum chewing, guns on laps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROADCAST VIDEO FOOTAGE: A REPORTER sits at the wheel of the video shot from the passenger seat. The reporter chec hair in the rearview and scours the street over the camer shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (nervous energy) Here they come. He starts the car. The video camera POV shifts to the emp backseat. Moments later, the back door opens. Darren, Smu Pope pile in and the car pulls away. The boys wear suits. cries. Smurf hugs him. Pope smiles. It's all chaotic.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Let's get away from here a bit. (then, to backseat) How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: We’re over the moon! We’re very over the moon! Fantastic! Smurf kisses Darren's head. Darren is crying tears of joy

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What about you, Andrew? Has justice been done today? Pope stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: We were innocent. We said that all along. That’s what the jury's said.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Janine. You must be delighted. what do you have to say?

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I want to say three cheers for the boys! Hip-hip.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: Hooray! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 110.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Smurf and Darren do three cheers. Pope looks out the wind

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: OK, let's get some nods before we forget. The CAMERA swings round to be on the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Tell me when you're set.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERMAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Set.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (to rearview) OK, guys, I just have to do what we call nods. You don't have to say anything. You'll see what it's about when it's all cut together. The reporter does some 'nods'. Then -

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So how do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: DARREN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: No. You don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the move, a SOG opposite J pulls his pistol and points J's face, the SOG’s eyes hidden behind sunglasses. Other sit quiet. The SOG holds the gun for a long while, then p the trigger. It clicks on an empty breach. J sits numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smurf in TV interview on the couch in a four-star hotel r

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I feel for the families of those two young police, my heart goes out, but two good young boys got killed too, Barry Brown and my son Craig. The shot is now wide to reveal Smurf sitting between Pope Darren on the couch. The boys hold glasses of white wine visibly drunk and fidgeting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 176 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 111.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: They were innocent young boys. My family's been dragged through the mud over this. And that kind of action plays heavy our on minds. Police start throwing their weight around, and they fly off the handle and a kid like J gets the idea he can’t even trust the law to work properly. The justice system. Pope lifts himself up drunkenly and leaves shot. Darren g and dials a phone on a side table behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: OK, maybe that's enough of that. (to Pope) Andrew, I was hoping to get some shots of you and Darren reacting to the news of your acquittal on Tv.

dialogues.speaker: POPE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Get us doing what?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: As if you were watching a news report on the TV, celebrating. Like you're going 'yay!' Darren drops the phone. It crashes down behind the side t He's very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: POPE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I’m not a fuckin monkey, mate. I’m not doing that. As this all takes place, Smurf remains in the middle of t couch, watching her boys. Then she turns to camera, smili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J hurriedly packs his clothes into a bag. He zips it shut turns to leave. SOGs mill in the hall ominously. J steps into the room. Leckie enters and shuts the door. He sits on the bed, sil staring at J. The moment is long and awkward.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: Have you worked out where you fit? J grabs his bag. He opens the door and closes it behind h  177 178 179 180 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOG talk halts, all eyes on J. He winds his way to the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the bedroom, Leckie sits like a lonely kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leckie with his wife, son and trolley. They round an aisl then Leckie sees Smurf. He ignores her. They head towards other. Leckie pushes his trolley straight past her. He th she hasn't seen him. Then Smurf appears beside him.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I don't wish you any ill will, Mr Leckie. I honestly don't. Leckie ignores her. His wife watches her, seriously unner

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I want you to know that. You were only doing your job. I hope you catch the people who did that terrible thing.

dialogues.speaker: LECKIE
dialogues.text: If you're as smart as I think you are, you'd know to walk right on by me like we'd never seen each other before in our lives. And you'd know to feel lucky. But you're gonna come unstuck I've got a feeling about it. I think you do too. I think you carry that feeling around with you every second of the day. Smurf looks at him, almost tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: But I don't, Nathan. Leckie leads his family away. Smurf is left in the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J steps out of a city cafe with a take-away coffee. He si on a ledge and stirs in sugar, lights himself a cigarette  181 182 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J walks the side of the house, bag on his shoulder, apprehensive. He hears MUSIC and LAUGHTER. He rounds the to see Darren on a banana lounge drinking, another man al drinking, and Pope at the BBQ flipping sausages. Darren stops mid-laugh, his unwitting friend carries on a longer. Pope casually continues to flip sausages.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: (warmly ) G'day, mate.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Hey. Hi, Daz. The dog rushes to J. He pats it.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: Smurf’s in the kitchen. Go and say hi. Grab yourself a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J enters. Smurf is at the bench, making salad. She turns sees J. She rushes to him. She hugs and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I was wondering when I’d see you again. I've been missing you. You want food? You look Biafran.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go lie down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: You don’t wanna eat? Pope’s cooking.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: I wanna lie down, I think.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: OK, love. Your room’s still there. Smurf takes J's head in her hands and kisses his lips. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 183 184 Animal Kingdom - GREEN REVISIONS 114.

dialogues.speaker: SMURF
dialogues.text: I missed you. INT. J’S BEDROOM / CODY HOUSE - DAY 183 The room is tidy. J is on the bed, lying on his side. He the bedroom door open, but doesn’t turn to look. Pope takes a seat at the end of the bed, holding a beer. looks around the room, taking it all in before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: POPE
dialogues.text: It's a crazy fuckin world. A GUN BLAST strikes Pope in the head and his body slumps sack of meat, instantly lifeless, to the floor. J climbs off the bed, holding a gun. He stands back and s the scene, standing over Pope's body. He exits to the hall still with the gun. As he heads for lounge, Smurf walks toward him, panicked, hands to her mo stops her. He holds her. She is strangely calm, catatonic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J leads Smurf across the room to the window, his arm arou Darren is outside, looking back at him, disoriented. J seems relaxed, composed. Darren is barefoot, holding a bottle and a long sausage in a slice of bread. J tosses the gun on the couch and kisses Smurf's head.
